div1.p: Kean refers to the Marie Gorgas and Hendrick biography of William Crawford Gorgas.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to L.O. Howard, May 6, 1924
div1.opener:
FROM L. O. HOWARD
OR LUCY HOWARD
HEADQUARTERS FIRST CORPS AREA
Army Base
Boston 9, Mass.
6 May 1924
JRT/FM
In Reply
Refer To
Dr. L. O. Howard,
Chief, Bureau of Entomology,
U. S. Department of Agriculture,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
Your letter of May 1st about Reed's work gave me the
greatest pleasure and satisfaction. I have taken the liberty to
send a copy of it to Mr. Burton J. Hendrick, the Editor of the
World's Work, not for publication but because he is a collaborator
with Mrs. Gorgas in the Gorgas biography. I hope that they will
correct the statements which are misleading and objectionable to
Mrs. Reed and Reed's friends.

After my retirement, a couple of months hence, I hope to
come to Washington to live and then shall give myself the pleasure
of calling on you.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, J. R. Kean.
